intro: Senecio riojanus var. riojanus, commonly known as the Rioja senecio, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of northern Spain. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a distinctive central disc. This species is often found in alpine meadows and is adapted to the cooler, high-altitude climates of its native habitat.
